nba.scrapers.draftkings module¶

class nba.scrapers.draftkings.DraftKingsNBAScraper¶

Examples

s = DraftKingsNBAScraper() s.contest_fn = (os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)), ‘results.csv’)) mm = s.contest_data(s.contest_fn) while True:

line=mm.readline() if line == ‘’: break print line.strip()
contest_data(fname)¶

Uses memory map instead of file_io due to filesize

Parameters:fname (str) – .csv file with draft kings contest results
Returns:mm – memory map of file
Return type:mmap
salary_data(fname)¶

nba.scrapers.fantasylabs module¶

class nba.scrapers.fantasylabs.FantasyLabsNBAScraper(use_cache=1, **kwargs)¶

Bases: EWTScraper.EWTScraper

Usage:

s = FantasyLabsNBAScraper() games_json = s.today() model_json = s.model() # model_name optional model_json = s.model(‘bales’)

for d in date_list(‘10_09_2015’, ‘10_04_2015’):
datestr = datetime.strf model_json = s.model(model_date=datestr)

TODO: can make FantasyLabsParser base class Most of this code is identical with NFL

games_day(game_date)¶

Gets json for games on single date

Usage:
s = FantasyLabsNBAScraper() content = s.game(game_date=‘10_04_2015’)
games_days(start_date, end_date)¶

Gets json for games in date range

Usage:
s = FantasyLabsNBAScraper() games = s.games(start_date=‘10_04_2015’, end_date=‘10_09_2015’)
games_today()¶

Gets json for today’s games

Usage:
s = FantasyLabsNBAScraper() content = s.games_today()
model(model_day=None, model_name=None)¶

Gets json for model, default to Phan model Stats in most models the same, main difference is the ranking based on weights of factors present in all models

Usage:
phan_model_json = s.model() bales_model_json = s.model(‘bales’)
models(start_date, end_date, model_name=None)¶

Gets json for models in date range, default to Phan model Stats in most models the same, main difference is the ranking based on weights of factors present in all models

Usage:
s = FantasyLabsNBAScraper() models = s.models(start_date=‘10_04_2015’, end_date=‘10_09_2015’, model_name=’phan’)

Bases: EWTScraper.EWTScraper

Usage:
s = NBAComScraper() content = s.team_dashboard(team_id=‘1610612738’, season=‘2015-16’)
boxscore(game_id, season)¶

Boxscore from a single game

Parameters:
  • game_id – numeric identifier of game
  • season – string in YYYY-YY format (2015-16)
Returns:

python data structure of json documnt
Return type:

content
boxscore_advanced(game_id)¶

Boxscore from a single game

Parameters:game_id – numeric identifier of game (has to be 10-digit, may need two leading zeroes)
Returns:python data structure of json document
Return type:content
boxscores(gids, season, box_type='both', save=False, savedir=None)¶

Download boxscores for all of the game_ids provided

Parameters:
  • gids (list) – nba.com game_ids
  • season (str) – in ‘2014-15’ format
  • box_type (str) – [‘base’, ‘advanced’, ‘both’]
Returns:

boxes – keys are the game_id, value is a dictionary with ‘base’ and ‘adv’ keys, that value is parsed json resource
Return type:

dict

playerstats(season, **kwargs)¶

Document has one line of stats per player

Parameters:season (str) – such as 2015-16
Returns:parsed json response from nba.com
Return type:content
scoreboard(game_date, **kwargs)¶
Parameters:kwargs –
Returns:content(str): json response
season_gamelogs(season, player_or_team, **kwargs)¶
team_dashboard(team_id, season, **kwargs)¶

measure_type allows you to choose between Base and Advanced per_mode can be Totals or PerGame date_from and date_to allow you to select a specific day or a range of days last_n_games allows picking 3, 5, 10, etc. game window

team_opponent_dashboard(season, **kwargs)¶

Returns team_opponent stats for every team in league

teams()¶

nba.com stores team_id and team_code as a variable in a javascript file

Parameters:None –
Returns:javascript file with js variable containing team_ids and team names
teamstats(season, **kwargs)¶

measure_type allows you to choose between Base and Advanced per_mode can be Totals or PerGame date_from and date_to allow you to select a specific day or a range of days last_n_games allows picking 3, 5, 10, etc. game window

nba.scrapers.pinnacle module¶

PinnacleNBAScraper.py Gets daily odds xml feed from pinnacle sports http://xml.pinnaclesports.com/pinnaclefeed.aspx?sporttype=Basketball&sportsubtype=nba

class nba.scrapers.pinnacle.PinnacleNBAScraper(**kwargs)¶

Bases: EWTScraper.EWTScraper

Gets daily nba game/odds xml feed from pinnacle sports
